isis.stitle: REPAIR INSTRUCTIONS FOR FIBERGLASS AND PLASTIC (ABS) MATERIAL - PLASTIC (ABS) - EPOXY ADHESIVE FILLERS

svcproc.title: EPOXY ADHESIVE FILLERS
svcproc.para: Intended for use in repairing deep scratches, nicks and small holes less than 1/4 inch (6 mm) in diameter.

note.para: Epoxy adhesive/fillers are a two-part compound: one part resin, one part hardener. Epoxy adhesive filler is not recommended for use on highly stressed areas or thin walled panels. There are a number of epoxy adhesive/fillers available that will work on ABS plastic.

step1.para: Dispense equal parts of the resin and hardener on a clean, nonporous surface such as plastic or glass. Mix thoroughly in quantities that can be used in 15 minutes or less ( Figure 41).

note.para: Working time of the mixture is approximately 15 minutes at 75°F (24°C). Application is best at 68°F (20°C). At temperatures below 65°F (18°C), it is recommended to pre-warm the application surface to above 68°F with a heat lamp.

important.para: Be careful not to overheat the surface of the damaged area. if the heat gun is held too closely to the surface, or it remains aimed at a small area, the surface can become discolored.

step1.para: Apply the mixture to the repair site slightly above the level of the desired contour.

step2.para: When used as an adhesive, apply to both sanded surfaces. Clamp the pieces together and smooth the excess adhesive with a plastic spreader or putty knife (refer to Figure 12).
When filling "V" grooves, fill all the area using a plastic spreader or putty knife. Apply pressure and extend coverage 1 to 1-1/2 inches (25 to 38 mm) beyond the "V" groove in either direction.

step1.para: Sand the filler material to the desired contour. Use coarse grit sand paper first and then finish sand and feather edge with fine grit.

note.para: Epoxy adhesive fillers can be sanded to a desired contour usually after a minimum of two hours after application. If epoxy adhesive/filler is used as an adhesive, let the material cure for a minimum of four hours at room temperature, preferably overnight for a complete cure.
